alert.note: Alert for Coastal Indian River; Coastal Martin; Coastal St. Lucie; Coastal Volusia; Mainland Northern Brevard; Mainland Southern Brevard; Northern Brevard Barrier Islands; Southern Brevard Barrier Islands (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 09 at 3:02AM EST until January 09 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 5 to 7 feet expected in the surf zone. For the Beach Hazards Statement, rough choppy surf and a strong northward flowing longshore current with a moderate risk of rip currents expected. * WHERE...Coastal Volusia, Coastal Indian River, Coastal Saint Lucie, Coastal Martin, and Coastal Brevard Counties. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, until 7 PM EST this evening. For the Beach Hazards Statement, through this evening. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Strong southerly winds will produce rough surf and a strong northward flowing longshore current today, which can push swimmers into deeper water unexpectedly and make them more susceptible to dangerous rip currents.
info.instruction: High surf will affect the beaches in the advisory area, producing localized beach erosion and dangerous swimming conditions. Swimmers should remain out of the water due to large breaking waves and dangerous surf conditions.
